item.title: Small Business Idea: Spatial Ingredient Pairings in AR
item.content:encoded:
FlavorFusion AR: Spatial Culinary Exploration

Brief Description:
An augmented reality application that leverages AI to generate and spatially visualize ingredient pairings and flavor profiles around a selected main ingredient, displayed interactively in the user's real-world space.

Core Value Proposition:
Unlock culinary creativity and discover new taste combinations through an intuitive, spatial, and engaging interactive experience.

Target Customers:
Home cooks, culinary enthusiasts, food bloggers, aspiring chefs, anyone looking to experiment with flavors in a novel way.

Minimum Viable Product (MVP) Scope (Implementable in a Day):
Build a simple AR application (using ARKit, ARCore, or AR Foundation).

  1. User Input: Implement a basic text input field allowing the user to type the name of a single main ingredient (e.g., "Apple", "Tomato").
  2. Simulated AI: Create a hardcoded dictionary or JSON file within the app containing a limited set of common ingredients mapped to 3-5 complementary pairing ingredients (e.g., {"Apple": ["Cinnamon", "Pork", "Cheddar"], "Tomato": ["Basil", "Mozzarella", "Garlic"]}). This serves as the AI's knowledge base for the MVP.
  3. AR Visualization: When the user submits an ingredient name from the hardcoded list:
    • Place an AR anchor point where the user taps the screen.
    • Display the main ingredient's name as 3D text centered at this anchor.
    • Display the corresponding pairing ingredients as smaller 3D text nodes orbiting or clustered around the main ingredient text in the AR space.
  4. Basic Interaction (Optional/Stretch): Allow tapping on a pairing node to trigger a simple visual change (e.g., change color slightly).

This MVP focuses purely on demonstrating the core concept: using user text input to trigger a data lookup (simulated AI) and visualize simple, related food data spatially in AR. The complexity is minimal, relying on basic UI, data structures, and AR object placement, making it achievable for an indie dev in a single day.
